title: Youth counselor accidentally shot 15-year-old in leg: police
content:
Harrisburg police say a youth counselor accidentally shot a teen Tuesday afternoon.
The 15-year-old boy was struck in the leg by a shot accidentally fired by the counselor at around 2:15 p.m. Tuesday, police said. The teen was attending a program at Alternative Rehabilitation Communities on the 2800 block of Penn Street in Harrisburg.
The student was taken to Milton S. Hershey Medical Center and is expected to recover.
Daniel Elby, CEO of Alternative Rehabilitation Communities, also described the shooting as an accident, telling PennLive the counselor pulled out the gun to show the kids he was with and it accidentally went off. Elby said he can't explain why the staffer pulled out the gun, but added that it wasn't as a disciplinary measure.
"We rely on our ability to talk to young people and solve problems," Elby said, reiterating that guns, handcuffs and other methods are not used to subdue youth in the company's programs.
Elby said the counselor is licensed to carry the firearm, but was in clear violation of the company's policy prohibiting guns on its property. He added that the part-time staffer is, a local minister in the community, is on unpaid administrative leave while the incident is investigated.
Police said the counselor is cooperating with police and the incident is under investigation.
This post has been updated with comment from Alternative Rehabilitation Communities.
